title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 330.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 330.2 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Voluntary protective custody
incarcerated individual. An incarcerated individual who is a potential
victim or a witness likely to be intimidated, or who lacks the ability to live in
the general facility community and who may for good cause be restricted from
communication with the general incarcerated population, and who voluntarily accepts
admission into protective custody status. (b) Involuntary protective custody
incarcerated individual. An incarcerated individual who may be a potential
victim or a witness likely to be intimidated, or who lacks the ability to live in
the general facility community and who may for good cause be restricted from
communication with the general incarcerated population, and who does not voluntarily
accept admission into protective custody status. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7
ยง
330.2

Amended

New

York State Register May 10, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 19, eff. 5/10/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
